title: Are there any new antenna technologies coming out for amateur radio communications? - Quora

response.answer_text: Everyone has a gimmick. Smaller, lighter, lite weight, fantastic gain, easy to use, low cost! Reality is a full size quarter wave radiator is rule of thumb. It’s what basic good antennas are based on. Anything less is a compromise. Multi-band antennas incorporated together will exhibit gain, but 1/4 wave radiators are what Antenna designs strive for. Many manufacturers produce Tri-Band and 5 band beams. Sure they work, but again a half wave radiator with director and reflector half wave works best at resonant frequency. That is no gimmic! W2hp

None that I am aware of. It’s just a mix of this and that. The so-called Hexbeam antennas have multi-band capability and have gain over a dipole. They are easily rotated and need not be high in the air to have good performance.
New models? One example is POTY[1] antenna for QO100[2] geostationary satellite  Footnotes[1] POTY dual feed antenna 2.4 & 10 Ghz for QO-100[2] Es’hail 2 / QO-100
